text: In the third year of the reign of Israel’s King Hoshea son of Elah, Ahaz’s son Hezekiah became king over Judah.

He <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he began to <st data-num="04427" class="">reign</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="08672" class="">nine</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">mother</st><n id="2" /> was <st data-num="021" class="">Abi</st>,<n id="3" /> the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st>.
He did what the Lord approved, just as his ancestor David had done.

<st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">eliminated</st> the <st data-num="01116" class="">high places</st>, <st data-num="07665" class="">smashed</st> the <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred pillars</st> <st data-num="07665" class="">to bits</st>, and <st data-num="03772" class="">cut down</st> the <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah pole</st>.<n id="1" /> He also <st data-num="03807" class="">demolished</st> the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="05175" class="">serpent</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> had <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">offering incense</st> to it; it was <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="05180" class="">Nehushtan</st>.<n id="3" />
He trusted in the Lord God of Israel; in this regard there was none like him among the kings of Judah either before or after.
He was loyal to the Lord and did not abandon him. He obeyed the commandments that the Lord had given to Moses.
The Lord was with him; he succeeded in all his endeavors. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and refused to submit to him.
He defeated the Philistines as far as Gaza and its territory, from watchtower to fortified city.
In the fourth year of King Hezekiah’s reign (it was the seventh year of the reign of Israel’s King Hoshea, son of Elah), King Shalmaneser of Assyria marched up against Samaria and besieged it.

<st data-num="07097" class="">After</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> he <st data-num="03920" class="">captured</st> it (in the <st data-num="08337" class="">sixth</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah’s</st> reign); in the <st data-num="08672" class="">ninth</st> <st data-num="01931 08141">year</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01954" class="">Hoshea’s</st> reign over <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st> was <st data-num="03920" class="">captured</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="01540" class="">deported</st> the people of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>. He <st data-num="05148" class="">settled</st> them in <st data-num="02477" class="">Halah</st>, along the <st data-num="02249" class="">Habor</st> (the <st data-num="05104" class="">river</st> of <st data-num="01470" class="">Gozan</st>), and in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of the <st data-num="04074" class="">Medes</st>.
This happened because they did not obey the Lord their God and broke his covenant with them. They did not pay attention to and obey all that Moses, the Lord’s servant, had commanded.
In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah’s reign, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched up against all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> this <st data-num="0559" class="">message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>, who was at <st data-num="03923" class="">Lachish</st>, “I have <st data-num="02398" class="">violated</st> our treaty.<n id="1" /> If you <st data-num="07725 05921">leave</st>, I will <st data-num="05375" class="">do</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whatever</st> you <st data-num="05414 05921">demand</st>.”<n id="2" /> So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="07760" class="">demanded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">that</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">pay</st> <st data-num="07969 03967" class="">300</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.
Hezekiah gave him all the silver in the Lord’s temple and in the treasuries of the royal palace.
At that time King Hezekiah of Judah stripped the metal overlays from the doors of the Lord’s temple and from the posts that he had plated and gave them to the king of Assyria.

The king of Assyria sent his commanding general, the chief eunuch, and the chief adviser from Lachish to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem, along with a large army. They went up and arrived at Jerusalem. They went and stood at the conduit of the upper pool which is located on the road to the field where they wash and dry cloth.
They summoned the king, so Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna, the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went out to meet them.
The chief adviser said to them, “Tell Hezekiah: ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: “What is your source of confidence?

Your <st data-num="0559" class="">claim</st> to have a <st data-num="06098" class="">strategy</st> and <st data-num="04421" class="">military</st> <st data-num="01369" class="">strength</st> is <st data-num="0389" class="">just</st> <st data-num="08193" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">talk</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">In</st> <st data-num="04310" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="06258" class="">are</st> you <st data-num="0982" class="">trusting</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> you would dare to <st data-num="04775" class="">rebel</st> against me?

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="02009" class="">look</st>, you must be <st data-num="0982" class="">trusting</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, <st data-num="02088" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07533" class="">splintered</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">reed</st> <st data-num="04938" class="">staff</st>. <st data-num="0834" class="">If</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="05564" class="">leans for support</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it, it <st data-num="0935" class="">punctures</st> his <st data-num="03709" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="05344" class="">wounds</st> him. <st data-num="03651" class="">That is what</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> does to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="0982" class="">trust</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> him.

Perhaps you will tell me, ‘We are trusting in the Lord our God.’ But Hezekiah is the one who eliminated his high places and altars and then told the people of Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship at this altar in Jerusalem.’

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="06148 04994">make a deal</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> the <st data-num="0854 04428">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>, and I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> you <st data-num="0505" class="">2,000</st> <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st>, <st data-num="0518" class="">provided</st> you <st data-num="03201" class="">can</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">find enough</st> <st data-num="07392" class="">riders</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> them.

<st data-num="0349" class="">Certainly</st> you will <st data-num="0349" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">refuse</st> <st data-num="06440 06346 0259">one</st> of my <st data-num="0113" class="">master’s</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">minor</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">officials</st> and <st data-num="0982" class="">trust</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> for <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st>.<n id="1" />
Furthermore it was by the command of the Lord that I marched up against this place to destroy it. The Lord told me, ‘March up against this land and destroy it.’”’”

Eliakim son of Hilkiah, Shebna, and Joah said to the chief adviser, “Speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Don’t speak with us in the Judahite dialect in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”

But the chief adviser said to them, “My master did not send me to speak these words only to your master and to you. His message is also for the men who sit on the wall, for they will eat their own excrement and drink their own urine along with you.”
The chief adviser then stood there and called out loudly in the Judahite dialect, “Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria.

<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says:</st> ‘<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> let <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="05377" class="">mislead</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he <st data-num="03201" class="">is</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> you from my <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>!<n id="1" />
Don’t let Hezekiah talk you into trusting in the Lord when he says, “The Lord will certainly rescue us; this city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.”

<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st>!’ <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> <st data-num="03541" class="">this is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>, ‘<st data-num="06213 0854">Send</st> me a <st data-num="01293" class="">token of</st> your <st data-num="01293" class="">submission</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">surrender</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me.<n id="1" /> Then <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> of you may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat from</st> his own <st data-num="01612" class="">vine</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">and</st> <st data-num="08384" class="">fig tree</st> and <st data-num="08354 0376">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> from his own <st data-num="0953" class="">cistern</st>,

until I come and take you to a land just like your own—a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive oil and honey. Then you will live and not die. Don’t listen to Hezekiah, for he is misleading you when he says, “The Lord will rescue us.”

Have <st data-num="0376" class="">any</st> of the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of the <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> <st data-num="05337" class="">actually</st> <st data-num="05337" class="">rescued</st> his <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> from the <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>?<n id="1" />

<st data-num="0346" class="">Where</st> are the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st> and <st data-num="0774" class="">Arpad</st>? <st data-num="0346" class="">Where</st> are the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of <st data-num="05617" class="">Sepharvaim</st>, <st data-num="02012" class="">Hena</st>, and <st data-num="05755" class="">Ivvah</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">Indeed</st>, did any gods <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st><n id="2" /> from my <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st>?<n id="3" />
Who among all the gods of the lands has rescued their lands from my power? So how can the Lord rescue Jerusalem from my power?’”
The people were silent and did not respond, for the king had ordered, “Don’t respond to him.”

Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported to him what the chief adviser had said.
